result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

records.addlTxt: Pretrial 9-2-22 at 9:40 AM and Return date 10-18-22 at 9:00 AM
Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Not possess any dangerous weapons as defined by Wis. State statute. Standard felony conditions.
Return date on October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:05 AM Cases called: 22CF130 and 22CF444. Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher J. Denman Sr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Christopher J. Denman Sr. 22CF444 is an initial appearance. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Bond recommendations. Court set $5000.00 cash bond. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Not to possess any dangerous weapons as defined by state statute. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. In 22CF130 Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. 9:14 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Return date scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
